Description: Terracotta male fecundity figure, probably Harpocrates. A squatting male. There is very summary treatment behind, and an applied but broken suspension-lug at the back of the neck. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, with a brown surface, perhaps a slip, on the front. Traces of a white dressing. The surface is much spalled.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Coptos (historic - city) (said to be from)
Curator's comments: BM Terracottas Bibliog. Phillips’ Sale Catalogue 1837: lot 41; Franks n.d.: M 61; Fischer 1994: 250, no. 525.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3146)
Additional IDs: Other BM number: 1837,0714.164 (formerly wrongly recorded under this number)
